    • Constructor Detail

      • GPSTracker

        public GPSTracker(android.content.Context context)

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentPosition

        public Position getCurrentPosition()
        Returns the position of the device as a Position object, whether or not we are tracking.
        Returns:
        position of the device

      • startTracking

        public void startTracking()
        Start recording distance and time covered by the device.

        Ideally this should only be called once the device has a GPS fix, which can be checked using hasPosition().

      • stopTracking

        public void stopTracking()
        Stop recording distance and time covered by the device.

        This will not reset the cumulative distance/time values, so it can be used to pause (e.g. when the user is stopped to do some stretches). Call startTracking() to continue from where we left off, or create a new GPSTracker object if a full reset is required.

      • isIndoorMode

        public boolean isIndoorMode()
        Is the GPSTracker in indoor mode? If so, it'll fake GPS positions. See also setIndoorMode().
        Returns:
        true if in indoor mode, false otherwise. Default is false.

      • setIndoorMode

        public void setIndoorMode(boolean indoorMode)
        By default, GPSTracker expects to be outside. For indoor testing/demo purposes, set indoor mode to true and fake GPS data will be generated as if the device was moving. See also setIndoorSpeed().
        Parameters:
        indoorMode - true for indoor, false for outdoor. Default is false.

      • setIndoorSpeed

        public void setIndoorSpeed(TargetTracker.TargetSpeed indoorSpeed)
        Sets the speed for indoor mode from the TargetSpeed enum of reference speeds. See also isIndoorMode().
        Parameters:
        indoorSpeed - enum

      • setIndoorSpeed

        public void setIndoorSpeed(float indoorSpeed)
        Sets the speed for indoor mode to the supplied float value, measured in m/s. See also isIndoorMode().
        Parameters:
        indoorSpeed - in m/s

      • canGetPosition

        public boolean canGetPosition()
        Deprecated. 
        Function to check GPS enabled
        Returns:
        boolean

      • hasPosition

        public boolean hasPosition()
        Do we have a GPS fix yet? If false, wait until it is true before expecting some of the other functions in this class to work - specifically startTracking() and getCurrentPosition()
        Returns:
        true if we have a position fix

      • isTracking

        public boolean isTracking()
        Is the GPS tracker currently recording the device's movement? See also startTracking() and stopTracking().
        Returns:
        true if the device is recording elapsed distance/time and position data. False otherwise.

      • onLocationChanged

        public void onLocationChanged(android.location.Location location)
        Called by the android system when new GPS data arrives.

        This method does all the clever processing of the raw GPS data to provide an accurate location and bearing of the device. It also increments the elapsedDistance when isTracking is true and the device is moving.

        Specified by:
        onLocationChanged in interface android.location.LocationListener

      • hasBearing

        public boolean hasBearing()
        Returns a boolean describing whether the device is moving on a known bearing. Use before getCurrentBearing() if you don't want to handle the -999.0f values returned by that method.
        Returns:
        true/false - is the deveice moving on a known bearing?

      • getCurrentBearing

        public float getCurrentBearing()
        Calculates the device's current bearing based on the last few GPS positions. If unknown (e.g. the device is not moving) returns -999.0f.
        Returns:
        bearing in degrees

      • onProviderDisabled

        public void onProviderDisabled(java.lang.String provider)
        Called internally by android. Not currently used.
        Specified by:
        onProviderDisabled in interface android.location.LocationListener

      • onProviderEnabled

        public void onProviderEnabled(java.lang.String provider)
        Called internally by android. Not currently used.
        Specified by:
        onProviderEnabled in interface android.location.LocationListener

      • onStatusChanged

        public void onStatusChanged(java.lang.String provider,
                   int status,
                   android.os.Bundle extras)
        Called internally by android. Not currently used.
        Specified by:
        onStatusChanged in interface android.location.LocationListener

      • getCurrentSpeed

        public float getCurrentSpeed()
        Returns the current speed of the device in m/s, or zero if we think we're stopped.
        Returns:
        speed in m/s

      • getElapsedDistance

        public double getElapsedDistance()
        Returns the distance covered by the device (in metres) since startTracking was called
        Returns:
        Distance covered, in metres

      • getElapsedTime

        public long getElapsedTime()
        Returns the cumulative time the isTracking() has been true. See also startTracking() and stopTracking().
        Returns:
        cumulative time in milliseconds
